content: About the North Korean rocketry: "The United States' view is this is serious, it's a violation and it merits an appropriately strong United Nations response," U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Susan Rice told the ABC program "This Week with George Stephanopoulos." (The NKs are a-shakin' in their booties.) In the mean time, Obama is cutting anti-missile defense programs. (But happy handouts to ne'er-do-wells and illegals shall carry on.) Obama's Constitution preamble includes ". . . promote the common defense, as long as it does not get in the way of providing the voter-buying welfare handouts. . . " Utterly, fricking brilliant! Jimmy Carter couldn't have done it any better. Deja vu, late 1970s.

content: I understand that the leftist weltanschauung demands that defense be viewed harshly--maybe say nice things about it, but "progressively" undermine it. But look at the near and middle-term practicality of funding the defense programs: (1) better than "shovel ready" in a year or two, these are ongoing operations here and now; (2) good-paying, highly skilled jobs are involved and cutting the programs will eliminate such jobs; (3) the results provide enhanced defensive status to the US. Considering the best outcomes possible for SPENDULUS crap, maintaining the jobs of the US defense industry would be a great improvement in the application of guvmint funds. Hey, the socialist pig of Venezuela applauds Obama's judgment about the missile defense program curtailment. Russia must be planning to send him some intermediate range ballistic missiles.
